text: I'm sorry newbie here, learning by doing and tying myself in knots. from list market catalogues the "market_catalogue.market_start_time" is returned in UTC time. What is the best way to return it in LOCAL time. For example the 13.10 in Bunbury is returning - 2020-04-18 12:10:00

elements.text: I'm sorry newbie here, learning by doing and tying myself in knots. from list market catalogues the "market_catalogue.market_start_time" is returned in UTC time. What is the best way to return it in LOCAL time. For example the 13.10 in Bunbury is returning - 2020-04-18 12:10:00

text:
There is probably a better way, but all I do is (from datetime import timedelta):

```uk_market_start_time = market_book.market_definition.market_time + timedelta(hours=1)```

elements.text: There is probably a better way, but all I do is (from datetime import timedelta):
uk_market_start_time = market_book.market_definition.market_time + timedelta(hours=1)

text:
I use
```pytz.utc.localize(betfair_datetime)```
Then you can use this timezone aware object to set the timezone you're interested in

text:
1. Make the datetime timezone aware: `market_catalogue.market_start_time.replace(tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)`
2. Convert the timezone aware datetime to your local time: `market_catalogue.market_start_time.replace(tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc).astimezone()`
3. Display the datetime with local timezone info as a string: `market_catalogue.market_start_time.replace(tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc).astimezone().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')`
Calling `strftime` on timezone naive datetime:

```market_catalogue.market_start_time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
'2020-04-18 09:00:00'```
Calling `strftime` on timezone aware datetime with local timezone info:

```market_catalogue.market_start_time.replace(tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc).astimezone().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
'2020-04-18 10:00:00'```

Display the datetime with local timezone info as a string:
